head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 13/5/73 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that I have this day received from Signor Zanardini of Venice, one of my Italian scientific Correspondents, four of his costly...

div.p: J73/10422, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to inform you, that I have this day received from Signor Zanardini of Venice, one of my Italian scientific Correspondents, four of his costly illustrated volumes on Mediterranean Seaplants, which valuable donation I have deposited in the Library of my Department.
The library at MEL has three of Zanardnini's publications on Mediterranean algae, Zanardini (1842),Zanardini (1847), and the first two vols ofZanardini (1860-74). Howeverthe copiesof Zanardini (1842)and Zanardini (1847) arephotocopies, so cannot be items given to M. The library also holds Zanardini (1858)and Zanardini (1872)whichboth,althoughthey donot match the geographic description,includeplates.The first volume of Zanardini (1860-74) and the copy of Zanardini (1872) have inscriptions from Zanardini to M.
I have now the honor to recommend, that a return gift may be rendered to this generous and celebrated savant by sending him on behalf of the Victorian Government my own here published works in return, and accordingly submit a requisition for your consideration.
The books were delivered to M; see M. to J Casey, 30 July 1873 (in this edition as 73-05-30a) and notes thereto.
I have the honor to be your obedient Servant
The hon. the Minister of Lands.
